abstract_summ: Our aim is to update the neurologists and physicians working with suspected cases of COVID-19 about the possible neurological presentations and the probable neurological complications resulting from this novel virus infection.Abbreviations: SARS-Cov-2, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2; COVID-19, coronavirus disease 2019;; RT-PCR, Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction; ED, emergency department; ICU, intensive care unit; GCS, Glasgow Coma Scale; HRCT, high resolution computed tomography; CT, computed tomography; MRI, magnetic resonance imaging; FLAIR, fluid attenuated inversion recovery; ADC, apparent diffusion coefficient; DWI: diffusion weighted imaging; CNS, central nervous system.The primary manifestation is respiratory and cardiac but neurological features are also being reported in the literature as case reports and case series.Severe acute respiratory syndrome–correlated new coronavirus (SARS-Cov-2) infection may result in neurological signs and symptoms through different mechanisms.This report suggests a possible association of SARS-COV-2 infection with neurological symptoms of demyelinating disease, even in the absence of relevant upper respiratory tract infection signs.
title_summ: Neurological manifestations and complications of COVID-19: A Literature ReviewEncephalitis associated with the SARS-CoV-2 virus: a case reportFirst case of SARS-COV-2 sequencing in cerebrospinal fluid of a patient with suspected demyelinating diseaseCOVID 19 associated encephalopathy: Neurological manifestation of COVID-19Neurological features of COVID-19 and their treatment: a review
title_abstract_phrases: Our aim is to update the neurologists and physicians working with suspected cases of COVID-19 about the possible neurological presentations and the probable neurological complications resulting from this novel virus infection.Encephalitis associated with the SARS-CoV-2 virus: a case reportThe severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) usually causes fever, respiratory symptoms, malaise and myalgia.The primary manifestation is respiratory and cardiac but neurological features are also being reported in the literature as case reports and case series.Abbreviations: SARS-Cov-2, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2; COVID-19, coronavirus disease 2019;; RT-PCR, Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction; ED, emergency department; ICU, intensive care unit; GCS, Glasgow Coma Scale; HRCT, high resolution computed tomography; CT, computed tomography; MRI, magnetic resonance imaging; FLAIR, fluid attenuated inversion recovery; ADC, apparent diffusion coefficient; DWI: diffusion weighted imaging; CNS, central nervous system.Here, we report a case of a patient with mild respiratory symptoms and neurological manifestations compatible with clinically isolated syndrome.
